testing the question is how is your application performance and its ability to scale so we have our staging

once it reaches your production environment so performance testing will determine whether your software meets
speed scalability and stability requirements under expected workloads there are a handful of different types
of performance testings that you can do the first is load testing which
determines your applications ability to handle expected user loads and the objective of this test is to identify
where there may be potential performance bottlenecks the next is stress testing
which is determining your applications ability to handle extreme workloads the objective of the stress test is defined
where your applications breaking point is additional you have endurance testing so determining our applications ability
to handle load over a long period of time it may perform well in the beginning but after running for some
period of time you may have performance degradation and then we have spike testing so determining what your
applications ability is to handle a large spike of user load in an instant and we have volume testing so
determining if your application performs depending on how full your databases are
sometimes you know operates very very well under small amounts of data in your
database but once you add a lot of data stops performing and then of course there's the scalability testing I'm
determining your applications ability to effectively scale up to support an increased user load and this helps you
